ITAL 470    ITALIAN CHILDREN LITERATURE 
 (Muratore / M-W 1:00-2:15PM)
Content:  Fables, short stories, rhymes, and fiction have been transferred from one generation to another, inspiring young people through sharing values, principles, and creativity. In particular, the goal of Children's Literature is to educate young readers with enjoyable stories.    
In this course we will focus on how Children's Literature reflects changes in Italian values and principles over the past 200 years. In addition, we will look at how the concept of childhood has evolved: from Pinocchio, written in the 19th century, to contemporary literature. 
 
 Books: course reader
